description: Rangers 4-0 Hearts: What the manager said
title: Rangers 4-0 Hearts: What the manager said
title_page: Rangers 4-0 Hearts: What the manager said - BBC Sport
maintext:
Rangers manager Jo Potter: "Extremely pleased.
"We knew it was never going to be an easy game, I think you could see the hard work we put into that game. I think tactically, we got it spot on because they can hurt you; they hurt us last time.
"We learned from that, tweaked a few things from the weekend, and the players are turning up; they're making my life hard to pick a team and keep them all happy.
"They've set standards over the past couple of weeks now, and I felt it was a comfortable victory, and we controlled the game for the majority."
Hearts manager Eva Olid: "I think the first minutes of the match we started making simple mistakes and mentally we couldn't recover from those mistakes.
"Mentally, I think we were not ourselves, and it's difficult because we need the ball to play and when we had the ball we were committing simple mistakes and losing it so easily.
"I think the confidence of the players went down. It's so frustrating because if you lose a game playing yourself, you cannot do anything, but I know we lost mainly because we didn't play like we did against Celtic, for example.
